goal: Optimize 30-dimensional Ackley function using IPOPT with scaled variables (-1 to 1) to improve convergence to global minimum

decisions.reasoning: Scaling the 30D Ackley problem from bounds [-32.768, 32.768] to [-1, 1] enabled IPOPT to converge to the global minimum (objective ≈ 1.94e-6). This demonstrates that proper scaling is crucial for gradient-based optimization of multimodal functions. The solution found has all variables extremely close to zero, confirming it's at the global minimum.
